title: Sebastian Kusch
text:
About me

I’m a PhD Candidate in the Inverse Complexity Group, specializing on Complex Systems and Network Science.
My research focuses on emergent complex systems described by multiple mechanisms, aiming to develop mathematical frameworks to distinguish between their causal effects on observed structural patterns using methods from Network Science, Complex Systems, Bayesian Statistics and Algorithmic Information Theory.

title: New Position
text: As of October 1st, I will be a PhD candidate at the Interdisciplinary Transformation University Austria (IT:U) in Linz. There I am part of the Inverse Complexity Group, working on Complex Systems and Network Science, led by Tiago Peixoto. You can find my work profile here.

Jun 21, 2024

title: NetSci24 Award
text:
At NetSci 2024, Quebec, I was honored with the Best Presentation Award by an early career researcher.
It is always exciting to spend time with old and new friends at NetSci and I’m very grateful for the recognition and support from the network science community. Below you can also have a look at my final poem!

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Research Interests

Network Science: Network Inference, Network Reconstruction, Network Algorithms.
Complex Systems: Statistical Physics, Algorithmic Information Theory, Emergence.
Data Science: Bayesian Inference, Machine Learning, Data Compression.
